Secret Sauce\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nFlawless execution of great events is often considered the end result of Encode Club’s efforts. In reality, however, these events are \"},{\"attributes\":{\"italic\":true},\"insert\":\"the means\"},{\"insert\":\" by which the true output and contribution to the web3 space is being achieved - identifying talent.\\n\\nEncode Club is a talent powerhouse. Their community consists of some of the brightest minds of tomorrow - actively participating in a wide variety of events, engaging with different technologies and most importantly - building.\\n\\nEnsuring and maintaining the level of talent is a continuous task. The following are some of the implemented techniques and approaches that keeps the talent bar high and rising.\\n\\n             \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"1. Sourcing\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nA significant amount of time and work is invested in making sure the best developers within a given ecosystem are both identified and made aware of an upcoming programme. To achieve this, the Encode team is keeping a close eye on every single event within the web3 space and tries to identify promising teams and projects alike. Getting in touch with them and inviting them to our own programme where they’ll be given a stage to perform and compete for great prizes is a priority. Furthermore, Encode Club is in direct communication with the majority of university blockchain clubs in existence around the world. Ensuring a close and warm bond with these societies contributes to a constant talent inflow for all Encode programmes. \\n\\n             \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"2. Education\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEncode’s focus on education and making sure it is as accessible as possible to the general web3 community has proven to be a very successful talent and attention acquisition strategy. All of the Encode Club programmes are built on a solid educational element which is taught by either Encode’s in-house teachers or by designated representatives from the project supporting Encode’s initiatives. The result of these sessions, workshops and lessons is then a solid knowledge base and a foundation for developers and programme participants to build upon.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             3. Support\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nManaging the talent within a programme and making sure participants are engaged and motivated to give their best is something Encode manages to achieve by dedicating manpower towers supporting everyone taking part in their programmes. Multiple programme managers usually spend the majority of their time on keeping in touch with the hackers as well as making sure to schedule several one-on-one calls that help hackers voice concerns, point out specific needs and generally provide more feedback. This technique of constant engagement has proven key to maintaining high levels of active programme participants which then leads to a subsequent high levels of project submissions as well.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             4. Reporting\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nAnother key point that differentiates Encode Club from their competitors is the neverending attention to detail and data-driven approach which is at the core of all of their activities. Encode partners get to benefit from this, by leveraging pre-existing information on talent taking part of their programmes, identifying the best participants and even directly engaging with them. This approach allows for spotting top hackers and systematically pinpoint top performers even if their current work is their very first engagement with a specific ecosystem.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             5. Engagement\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nFinishing a programme is anything but the end for a hacker’s journey when it comes to their Encode experience. Encode will make sure to go the extra mile for all participants that have shown exceptional skills and dedication throughout a programme and make sure to follow up and provide support throughout these builders’ web3 journeys. Such may include, but not limited to - introductions to other prominent members of the Encode developer community, providing feedback for future projects, as well as facilitating intros to potential investors.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"IV. Proposal\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode Club will dedicate 8-10 people from their team to deliver an exclusive pilot grants programme that will run for the duration of the first half of 2023 with the option of extending it until the end of the year. Their team will be responsible for handling each and every phase of the project including, but not limited to planning, promoting, sourcing, executing and judging.\\n\\nThe Evmos community and team are to be an integral part, functioning as a guiding power and influencing the general direction of the programme that the Encode team shall pursue in order to accomplish the objectives outlined by the DAO.\\n\\nEncode is to be allocated $2-5MM for the duration of the grants programme. The amount will be kept within a multisig, with distributions approved and executed by the Evmos committee multisig in the form of rewards. Their recipients are to be the best developers and projects picked by Encode for fulfilling the prerequisites and goals outlined by the programme.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"V. Reasoning\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode Club’s core goal has always been to deliver top tier programmes that aid enthusiasts, developers and projects alike in growing, achieving their goals and pushing the web3 space forward. Evmos is a young and blooming ecosystem, and similar to others at this stage of their growth - it is in need of builders that would keep pushing it further and raise the bar higher.\\n\\nBy leveraging the curiosity, knowledge and dedication of their 50,000+ strong developer community, Encode Club can foster high levels of engagement and building for the Evmos ecosystem. Coupled with their past experience of running \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://medium.com/encode-club/bounties4bandits-the-bandits-have-saddled-up-39c2ae45f676\",\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Saddle’s successful grants programme\"},{\"insert\":\", their track record proves they are more than capable of successfully executing a programme of this magnitude.\\n\\nVI. Past Experience\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe last time Encode was entrusted with running a grant programme was during the early months of 2022 when Saddle delegated the responsibility for running several editions of these to the Encode team. The two installments of the programme proved to be very successful and the young project managed to engage hundreds of developers to explore, build and contribute to their project.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             1. Delegation\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEncode shines most prominently when entrusted with handling as many of the intricacies of a given programme as possible. Once general deliverables and goals were outlined by both parties, Encode was then allowed to lead the rest of the programme on its own with regular check-ins and update calls added to the diary in advance. This led to programme specific decisions to be made within Encode based on their team’s expertise, while keeping the sponsors with a hand on the wheel regarding the general direction of the programme itself.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             2. Preparation\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nMultiple calls were done by both parties in order to properly identify the needs of the sponsor and the extent to which Encode can adjust in order to meet them. The results were carefully crafted tracks of challenges (both technical and non-technical) that were to serve as a guiding point for developers and enthusiasts alike to try and conquer. Example of such were:\\n\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Technical Bounties\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nFork Saddle code to bring stablecoin swaps to alt chains\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Applications and integrations built with/on top of Saddle\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Staking functionality on Saddle dApp\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"dApp dashboard for Saddle LPs\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Analytics for Saddle protocol and pools\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Non-technical Bounties\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nUsability research and user testing\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Saddle swag mockups\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Memes\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Saddle-inspired NFT art\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"AMAs with your favourite crypto communities\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"\\t\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe challenges proved to be a great mix of both accessible and hard to accomplish, which led to great levels of engagement from both within and outside the Encode community.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             3. Execution\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nSeries of events were outlined from the get go to keep the public informed and engaged with the developments around the grants programme. With all of them being live, participants had the opportunity to directly engage with both the Saddle and Encode team, ask questions and get support for their projects.\\n\\nAdditional educational events were included, hosted by Encode with speakers from Saddle, that would provide further depth to the bounties and a proper way to tackle them in a way that would lead to a successful grant allocation. These sessions proved key for keeping the community’s attention high and up-to-date with all latest developments.\\n\\nLastly, dedicated highlight events were introduced to serve as a show-and-tell for developers and builders, where they would get the chance to present their work in front of the grants team and eventually compete for one. Those event ended up as a fantastic opportunity for grant participants to compare their work and receive constructive feedback from the Saddle team.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             4. Evaluations\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nOnce the first batch of grants were distributed, the Encode team went through a vigorous evaluation process with the Saddle team. The purpose of this was to maintain a close connection with their team as well as make sure their goals were being met accordingly and standard of the programme and its execution would meet their high expectations.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"VII. Success Stories\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nHaving organised so many successful programmes over the past several years, Encode is proud to have witnessed multiple great stories of hard work, true dedication and subsequent great success. The following are just a few of projects that came to exist through Encode and went on to conquer the heights of the web3 space.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             1.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://0xmons.xyz/#/\",\"underline\":true,\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\" 0xmons\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nA winner of one of Encode Club’s 2021 hackathons. Known for their distinctive pixel images generated by a GAN, the project proved to be one of the most valuable and well recognized projects of the NFT space even prior to the great boom and NFT movement later that year. Their founder went on to later build a side project, which resulted in being one of the biggest decentralised NFT marketplaces - \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://sudoswap.xyz/#/\",\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Sudoswap\"},{\"insert\":\".\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             2. \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://floatprotocol.com/#/\",\"underline\":true,\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Float Protocol\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://floatprotocol.com/#/\",\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"\\t\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nA hackathon finalist from 2021, Float Protocol stood out with its innovative protocol design for a fully decentralised and non-dollar pegged stablecoin. Challenging the norm of dollar-pegged stablecoins at the time resulted in the protocol capturing the attention of the majority of the DeFi space, which led to the protocol amassing an excess of 1 billion in total value locked upon launch. Their success was soon followed by an investment by DeFi allstars like Stani Kulechov, 0xMaki, MCV and the LAO.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             3. \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://footium.club/\",\"underline\":true,\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Footium\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nAfter being selected among the best projects to take part in Encode’s Accelerator programme back in 2020, Footium ended up maturing into one of the finest and most promising NFT games within the space. Their hard work and commitment to creating the best football manager game in the web3 space was widely recognised and soon led to a successful investment led by the London-based VC firm BACKED, as well as others such as Animoca Brands, Stride.VC and YGG.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             4. \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://www.euler.finance/\",\"underline\":true,\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Euler Finance\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nA 2020 participant from one of Encode’s earliest Hackathons, Euler was then crowned winner. Their innovative lending protocol idea went through a two-year long development journey, which saw the product finally getting released to the public in early 2022 and is currently being considered one of Aave and Compound’s direct and biggest competitors. Along the way, the team managed to catch the attention of some of the most prominent investors in the space and secure more than $40 million in investments led by Paradigm.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"VIII. Process\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             1. Outline\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEncode Club will crowdsource ideas for bounties from the community and will decide what bounty size to allocate for each. Each of the bounties should consist of:\\n\\t\\nBrief summary and explanation\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Clearly outlined deliverables\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Execution and delivery within the timeline of the programme\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Amount of funding attached\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThere will be two types of bounties:\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Competitions\"},{\"insert\":\" – several projects compete and the best gets the bounty award at the end of the programme.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Award\"},{\"insert\":\" – a single team is selected to answer the bounty, and receives the award upon completion by the end of the programme.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nBounties will be listed on the Encode website and public calls for participants will be made. Encode Club will take care of promoting and marketing the initiative as well as organise several education events with community members and investors from the Evmos community throughout the bounty period.\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\" \"},{\"insert\":\"\\nTeams then engage in working, building and polishing their projects by the deadline outlined in the programme. The best are to be invited, judged and rewarded in proportion to their efforts and magnitude of impact for the Evmos ecosystem in a show and tell finale events organised by Encode.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             2. Bounties\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nBounties are to be outlined in advance with the help of both prominent community members as well as the input from the core Evmos team. Different bounties, challenges and tracks may be both added or subtracted throughout the duration of the programme based on the project submissions and subsequent reward allocations.\\n\\nIn order to properly involve the community, Encode shall create dedicated discord channels for the programme and aggregate all proposals before finalising a complete list of bounties and allocating a portion of the rewards pool for each. \\n\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             3. Promotion\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEncode will rely heavily on their existing communication and social networking channels including \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://discord.gg/HMgKat3W\",\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Discord\"},{\"insert\":\", \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://medium.com/encode-club\",\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Medium\"},{\"insert\":\" and \"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://twitter.com/encodeclub\",\"underline\":true},\"insert\":\"Twitter\"},{\"insert\":\". These have proven successful multiple times in the past by driving organic growth, word of mouth and interest in their programmes. Several representatives of the Encode team shall take care of engaging with prospective participants and work on generating interest towards the programme on a daily basis.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             4. Execution\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nThis is where Encode Club excels at - with multiple dedicated programme managers, their team can provide unmatched attention to detail and participant support in order to ensure continuous engagement and ensure developers end up fulfilling the potential of the projects and goals they’ve set to accomplish.\\n\\nDedicated 1-1 calls on a regular basis provide further insight into what teams are doing, what bounties they’re working on as well as the roadblocks they’re encountering. This information is crucial and addressing the team’s input and feedback in time guarantees higher participation numbers and increased submission rates.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             5. Communication\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEncode Club will hold regular office hours within their discord for community members, builders and Evmos representatives to join for an unstructured discussion, allowing for people to ask questions, share opinions and voice concerns.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             6. Rewards\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nRewards will too follow the same pattern as the bounties, with each getting a reward range agreed in advance and subject to change depending on project submissions and allocation of rewards. Rewards will be initiated upon successfully covering the bounty requirements, with the prizes being distributed directly from the DAO treasury and approved by the committee multisig.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             7. Hiring Support\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEncode Club is a talent hub and a hiring pipeline for many of its partners. As such, it has dedicated personnel working hard to identify talented individuals, help them fulfill their potential and eventually see them hired or start their own companies within the web3 space. Throughout the grants programme, our talent team will work closely with its participants to try and connect them with like-minded individuals, possessing the qualities they are looking for in order to elevate the level of the project they’re working on. Additionally, they’ll focus on highlighting the best builders to the Evmos team working on exploring employment options for them within the ecosystem.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"             8. Iteration\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nEven though Encode has conducted multiple programmes like these in the past, it would be a mistake not to acknowledge that each of these vary in some respect based on a number of factors such as chain complexities, market conditions, programme-specific intricacies. Therefore, Encode Club shall actively monitor and take both the community’s and the Evmos’ team feedback into account and move swiftly to iterate where needed in order to meet the goals of the grants programme set off to achieve.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"IX. Evmos Committee\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nIn order to ensure transparency and accountability on Encode Club’s side an Evmos Committee shall be formed with representatives from both the community and the Evmos team. It will be in direct communication with Encode and will have power to challenge their decisions along the way.\\n\\nFurthermore a multisig controlling the funds associated with the grants programme shall be formed that may or may not consist of the same members as the committee. The purpose of the multisig is to be overseeing the funds allocation and provide an additional layer of security for Evmos.\\n\\nWith the help of the Evmos team, Encode Club will release a call to action to the Evmos community in an attempt to promote the chance to be on the Evmos committee and multisig for this programme. Exact execution and steps towards the creation of the committee will be finalised if the programme is to be approved from the DAO. \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"X. Costs Breakdown\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nFurthermore a multisig controlling the funds associated with the grants programme shall be formed that may or may not consist of the same members as the committee. The purpose of the multisig is to be overseeing the funds allocation and provide an additional layer of security for Evmos.\\n\\nEncode is a 25 person team and will be putting significant effort across multiple departments and individuals. The following is a rough outline of the costs associated with the proper execution of the grants pilot programme.\\n\\nMarketing and Sourcing: $10k per month (on average 2 people)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Programme Management: $15k per month (on average 2 people)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Grant Team Management: $15k per month (on average 2 people)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Book-keeping, Finances + Admin: $2.5k per month (on average 1 person)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Hiring support for any grantees: $5k per month (on average 1 person)\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Tech and Infrastructure: $2.5k per month\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\" \"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThis brings the total monthly cost of running the programme to $50k. The amount is to be invoiced in advance prior every month and deducted from the total grant size allocated for the program execution.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"XI. Conclusion\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":2},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode Club’s plan is to make this proposal available to the public for early evaluation and feedback by the end of December with the possibility of putting it to a vote in early January. If successful, Encode will be able to start executing as early as mid/late January.\\n\\nGathering bounty proposals from both the community and the Evmos team will begin immediately after approval. The marketing team will switch focus on promoting the grant programme, while also turning the attention of Encode’s existing Cosmos and Evmos hackers within the community to the upcoming event.\\n\\nGrant applicants will work closely with Encode Club’s programme managers throughout the duration of the program in order to ensure that their work follows the guidelines and meets the requirements outlined by the bounties in order to qualify for a grant. Encode will impose deadlines for project submissions, after which the best builders will be invited to present their work live and compete for a prize from the grants pool.\\n\\nEncode activities will remain under the constant supervision of the Evmos committee at all times and transactions will be executed via the trusted multisig.\\nXII. FAQ\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"This is a big commitment/investment for the community - what happens if the quality of the projects submitted is not as high as the grants put aside for the programme?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe grants budget will never leave the Evmos Committee Multisig. It’s just a number that the DAO will be willing to deploy if the project submissions end up satisfying the requirements outlined by the programme. All unused funds will remain in the multisig and/or returned directly to the DAO for utilisation in other projects.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Who is going to be controlling these funds?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nAn Evmos committee will be formed to govern the funds and approve expenditures. It will be composed (ideally) by prominent community members, trusted team members as well as validators.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"How is the Evmos community going to be involved in this?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nThe Evmos community can help with providing ideas for structuring the grant programmes and help identifying key areas that should be addressed by the challenges. Additionally, certain representatives may be invited to join the governing body that will be overseeing the execution of the programme.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Why Encode and not someone else?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode Club is one of the most experienced web3 education communities with a proven track record of successful high level execution of a wide range of programmes. With a numerous and strong chain-agnosting developer community they are an ideal candidate for a programme of the magnitude and importance of the Evmos grants.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Is the programme going to a public one? How easy will it be for the community to follow or get involved?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode Club will host regular public events for both informational and educational purposes, the purpose of which will be to help potential participants to get to know the best ways to become involved, submit a project and win a grant.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Who gets to decide which projects get to receive grants?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode club will rely on pre-defined and outlined criteria for picking grant winners. Once such are identified, they will be passed on to the Evmos committee along with the grants that Encode has suggested for allocation. If approved by the committee, the grants size will be deducted from the grants budget in the Committee Multisig.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"What happens to open grantees in the event of Encode’s programme not being renewed past the initial period?\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nEncode Club will construct windows for grants being awarded such that if the programme is terminated after the initial 6 months, there will be no outstanding grants. For teams awarded within that 6 months, we will continue to provide support (unless asked otherwise) for a period of 3 months.\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\"}]}"}

topic.name: 3. Community Treasury
topic.description: Governance Proposal to ask for funds from the community treasury

result.title: Signal proposal to provide $EVMOS incentives for $EVMOS borrowing pool on Carbon money market (Nitron)
result.plaintext:
Summary

Powered by Carbon protocol, Nitron is a decentralized non-custodial money market where users can participate as depositors (lenders), borrowers or liquidators permissionlessly. Nitron supports external liquidity mining rewards, which communities can add permissionlessly as additional incentives.

This proposal seeks approval to allocate 13,390* (~$5000 worth of) $EVMOS from the Evmos community treasury fund to act as incentives for users to bootstrap the lending and borrowing supply of $EVMOS, on Nitron.

Voting yes on this proposal indicates consent to transfer 13,390 $EVMOS from the Evmos community fund to <wallet address: evmos1nfkyc33ssnqslrgwf2zw06c4tjway0zfqt0afd> which is managed by Switcheo Labs.

*This exchange rate is based on 1 $EVMOS = $0.3734, as reflected on CoinMarketCap , at time of submission.

The Carbon Money Market Strategic Approach

Activation of Incentive Module: Nitron aims to be the default money market for all chains on Cosmos. Protocols can encourage better community participation with the ease and flexibility of Nitron.

For the community, on top of earning income from lending out assets, earnings will also be accumulated from bootstrapped rewards. This is so long as incentives are in place and active.

How Nitron’s CDP feature complements perfectly with $EVMOS to generate more yield for the Evmos Community

The rollout of Nitron will unlock tremendous capital efficiency gains for lenders and borrowers, as well as improve liquidity for the wider Evmos ecosystem.

A collateralized debt position (CDP) is the position created by locking collateral in a smart contract; With Nitron’s CDP feature, holders of $EVMOS can productively use their idle $EVMOS assets and compound their yield:

Supply $EVMOS on Nitron to earn lending fees on Nitron.

The loaned $EVMOS amount can also be accepted as collateral to borrow against other yield-generating assets.

Deposit $EVMOS as collateral directly on Nitron to leverage and borrow against other yield generating assets; Users can subsequently use the borrowed assets to trade, while waiting for $EVMOS’s price action to kick in.

To find out more about Nitron, click here .

Unlocking EVEN more yield for Evmos community through bootstrapping $EVMOS rewards

With no other money markets (e.g. Aave, Umee, Coslend) supporting $EVMOS currently, the Evmos community lacks a money market. With Nitron’s launch, we aim to bridge this gap and become the primary, go-to money market for the Evmos community:

Nitron will be supporting lending/borrowing for $EVMOS, which is one of the most popular tokens amongst community members on the Carbon chain, and in high demand.

On top of lending/borrowing, with the incentive module, Nitron allows for additional token incentives to be awarded, giving users additional yield. Thus, we propose to incentivize $EVMOS rewards, from the Evmos community fund, for $EVMOS borrowing pools for 1 month.

By incentivizing $EVMOS borrow pools with 13,390 $EVMOS (~$5,000), the estimated APR is as follows -

(image)

Should this proposal be passed, apart from enjoying lending fees for loaning out $EVMOS, the above borrowing incentives will also encourage users to borrow $EVMOS. This will bootstrap a vibrant lending / borrowing market for $EVMOS, giving the Evmos community top-tier liquidity on a non-custodial platform.

Amount

13,390 $EVMOS

Wallet/Recipient

Wallet address: evmos1nfkyc33ssnqslrgwf2zw06c4tjway0zfqt0afd

Managed by Switcheo Labs

Risks

Low eventual traction could result in incentives being underutilized.

We hope to push this proposal out by 20th December, 2022 (Tuesday), 2pm SGT.

This proposal is initiated by the Switcheo Labs team.

result.title: DoraHacks%20Hackathon%20Proposal%20with%20Evmos
result.plaintext:
Purpose:

DoraHacks is a global hacker movement and the world's most active multi-chain Web3 developer incentive platform. More than 3,000 projects from the DoraHacks community have received over $30 million in grants and hackathon prizes. DoraHacks.io has around 250,000 active users worldwide. The platform offers hackathons, bounties, quadratic funding, privacy voting, and other community governance/funding toolkits. In addition, over 80 major Web3 ecosystems are currently using Dora infrastructures to fund their open-source communities.

The Evmos Hackathon Partnership aims to align all stakeholders by incentivizing individuals and organizations to explore and develop their ideas on Evmos by offering individuals and organizations non-dilutive funding to develop and further the Evmos ecosystem.

Goal:

Branding

To leverage DoraHacks’ developer community and DoraHacks.io platform’s traffic to promote Evmos’s dev toolkits and APIs, and onboard more developers to adopt Evmos’s tech stacks and build on Evmos.

To leverage DoraHacks’ expertise in organizing hackathons, virtual or in-person hackathons, workshops, and project demo sessions to help the Evmos team operate developer events globally.

To involve Evmos in the hackathons, quadratic funding community grants and other events DoraHacks co-host with different open Web3 ecosystems, for instance, BNB Chain, Solana, Filecoin, Avalanche, Moonriver, Polygon, Harmony and more.

Education

To host workshops for developers to help them better understand how to build in the Evmos Ecosystem.

Innovation

To incentivize global developers to build on Evmos by providing prizes, grants, and investments to the teams emerging from the events DoraHacks and Evmos organize together.

Scope of Partnership:

	1. Hackathons

DoraHacks will host virtual and in-person hackathons globally each year. DoraHacks can help the Evmos Foundation with the following:

Facilitate Evmos global and regional hackathons, dedicated fully to the ecosystem growth of Evmos.

Participate in DoraHacks hackathons, co-hosted with other leading blockchain companies and open ecosystems, as a co-host/sponsor/partner, depending on the exclusivity and scope of the hackathons.

In the hackathons, DoraHacks will be covering the main operational efforts, including:

Basic Logistics of the hackathons - agenda, workshops, judge invitations, promotion material design, etc.

Hacker and team recruitment: DoraHacks will work with global partners to recruit participants for the hackathon.

Evmos will be expected to provide the following resources:

Prize Pool - the incentive for global devs to participate. From our experience, $100K worth of prize pool can incentivize 50-100 teams to join and build in the Evmos ecosystem. (Prize pool TBC, at the discretion of Evmos Foundation)

Idealists and tracks - Which sectors do you want participating developers and teams to be the focus of the hackathon?

Invitation of Mentors and part of the Judging panel - core team members are expected to participate in the hackathons to support participating teams and devs.

Workshops - to better guide devs and projects on project development.

Workshops can be divided into two categories: technical workshops and business workshops. Speakers can give presentations depending on their expertise. Mentors are also expected to deliver workshops to hackathon participants.

Marketing Resources - the foundation’s official resources are crucial in the success of the promotion of the Hackathon. Press releases in leading media channels, Twitter promotion and interaction, important promotion efforts like CoinMarketCap and CoinGecko banners, etc.

2. Quadratic Funding Community Grants (Optional, TBC)

DoraHacks will host quadratic funding grants with open Web3 ecosystems on DoraHacks’ developer incentive platform DoraHacks.io. DoraHacks can help Evmos Foundation with the following:

Facilitate Evmos global and regional quadratic funding grants fully dedicated to the ecosystem growth of Evmos.

Participate in DoraHacks’ quadratic funding grants, co-hosted with other leading blockchain companies and open ecosystems, as a co-host/sponsor/partner, depending on the exclusivity and scope of the quadratic funding grant.

In the quadratic funding grants, DoraHacks will be covering the main operational efforts, including:

Basic logistics of the quadratic funding grants - agenda, workshops, judge invitation, promotion material design, etc.

Hacker and team recruitment - DoraHacks will work with global partners to recruit participants for the quadratic funding grants.

Timeframe:

Q1/2 2023 - TBC

Kick-off Preparation

Evmos team to confirm the details of the hackathon (Kick-off/closing dates, prizes, tracks, idea lists, partners, goals, scale, budget)

Set up meetings with DoraHacks to confirm the details

Q1 2023

Evmos and DoraHacks team finalize on tracks and idea lists

Evmos and DoraHacks team reach out to partners and judges

Evmos and DoraHacks teamwork on the landing page and promotion materials.

DoraHacks deploys the Evmos Hackathon page.

All tracks/idealists confirmed

All mentors/judges confirmed

All workshop confirmed

Landing page done

DoraHacks & Evmos jointly promote on all channels to recruit global developers to apply for the hackathon.

All media partners confirmed

Official Hackathon promotion + developer community promotion + project submission

Late Q1/Q2 2023 (TBC)

Evmos Hackathon Opening Ceremony(Virtual, hosted by DoraHacks)

Evmos Hackathon workshops from core team and partners (Virtual)

Campaign on all social media platforms and media

Submissions

Project Submission

Project demo session of selected excellent projects

Judging

Judges decide on the winners of the hackathon

Evmos Global Hackathon Closing ceremony(Hosted by DoraHacks)

Post Hackathon

Promotion and incubation of star projects coming out from the hackathon.

Preparation for Evmos Hackathon 2.

DoraHacks Hackathon & QF Grant Partnership Track Record:

Previous Dora hackathons have been a great success for both DoraHacks and our partners. We are have been able to fund a significant amount of new teams, together with driving the growth of ecosystems, helping onboard many new developers with solid long term projects.

(90% of our hackathons are global VIRTUAL operations, they don’t require physical attendance, hence not going to be operational heavy for your team)

Please refer to the below links to see some of the previous hackathons hosted by DoraHacks on Dorahacks.io, as well as some stand out projects that have come from these hackathons.

BNB Grant - 1, 216 submissions ( CryptoSat , Zecrey )

KlayMakers22 Hackathon, 174 submissions ( KlayOracle , Klaylabs )

Solana SummerCamp Hackathon, 119 submissions ( Ora , Elusiv )

Avalanche Hackathon, 151 submissions ( Cyberpop , Mystiko , Via.exchange )

ETHDenver IRL, 171 submissions ( IdentDefi , Deux La Securitas )

Polygon Grant Hackathon, 137 submissions ( Showme , Cruzo )

Solana Season Hackathon, 94 submissions ( Solend , 1Sol )

LOOK OUT

We will be posting 2 more threads in the near future regarding:

Long term Evmos Grant DAO program

Sustainable long term GrantDAO and Hackathon model, through Evmos Foundation delegation and DoraHacks running a validator node.

topic.name: 3. Community Treasury
topic.description: Governance Proposal to ask for funds from the community treasury

result.title: Galxe Campaign: Adjusted Proposal Temperature Check for a 2nd Vote
result.plaintext:
Background

This is aimed at checking community sentiment and starting discussion around amending the initial Galaxe Campaign proposal, and to fund this initiative to help support current and future builders on Evmos. The original proposal did not pass, but after further discussion there has been interest signaled to try this again with adjustments. The main goal of the Galxe campaign initiative is to give Evmos builders more resources, and provide an engaging opportunity to gain new users.

The Galxe campaigns will not only grab the attention of new users to explore Evmos, but this will become a tool for current and future builders to utilize to help gain exposure for their projects and reach their growth targets. Once integrated, any new project on Evmos in the future can run their own campaign. Here is a list of projects/teams that have signaled interest and that would be able to participate in this campaign:

Orbital Apes

Diffusion

SpaceFi

C14

Kinesis

Saddle Finance

Hadron Finance

Midas Capital

Bridges (Satellite, Celer, Gravity)

Earnmos

Evmos Domains

Taking into account community concerns and the current environment, this temperature check will make TWO main amendment:

The total ask will be reduced to $100K in EVMOS tokens. Please use the poll to show if you support this amount or not.

The tokens distributed from this initial campaign are not distributed until campaign completion, but to ease concerns about "Airdrop Hunters" these tokens will be distributed over a 3-6 month period, similar to a vesting schedule

As you can see in the original proposal below, these campaigns are designed by each individual team that are geared towards their individual growth needs on and off chain. This is FREE for builders to use, and the Galxe team is waiving all integration costs. This would be the start of a long term relationship with the Galxe team that will provide a long term resource for builders in the Evmos ecosystem. All of these tokens will end up in the hands of users, and only after going through and exploring the Evmos ecosystem.

Please review the proposal below with supporting details on previous campaigns they've done, review the previous linked thread with community input, use the polls here to communicate intention, and please provide any and all feedback you may have.

This will not go on chain unless we receive clear signal and overwhelming support, so please express your opinion no matter what your thoughts are.

Reposting the proposal from the Galxe team :

Summary

The Galxe team proposes allocating $100K USD in EVMOS  to fund targeted campaigns and initiatives that provides Evmos with exposure to new users and drives organic growth on-chain. Leveraging our existing user base and previously successful campaigns, Galxe will guide users through the Evmos ecosystem to complete on and off-chain tasks and reward them with EVMOS tokens for doing so.  These campaigns will involve partnerships with current Evmos dapps, and can expand to more other protocols as they launch on Evmos as well.  With a large portion of the Rektdrop  being clawed back, users who missed out have a chance to engage with the ecosystem. This will bring value to the Evmos community through expanding the user base, and providing outside users with direct exposure to Evmos and its native dapps.

These funds will be sent to a multisig comprised of Evmos community members and Validators to ensure accountability for the distribution of funds. (TBD)

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

Motivation

Galxe is the leading Web3 credential data network in the world. A collaborative credential infrastructure enabling brands and developers to engage in communities and build robust products in Web3. Galxe’s infrastructure allows dApps to grow their community off chain and their protocol on chain through Galxe’s tools. Think of Galxe as a way to deploy on chain loyalty programs and customized growth marketing campaigns by distributing NFT badges. Up to this point, Galxe has over 11,100+ credentials contributed to its network, worked with over 1,200+ ecosystem partners, produced 8,000+ campaigns, and built up a community of 8.2M+ Galxe ID users.  Credentials are a user’s footprint on or off the blockchain that represents their behaviors and actions taken (e.g., follow twitter, retweet, attend an AMA, swapping, staking, farming etc.)

Diffusion, Orbital Apes, and SpaceFi have already agreed to be part of the Evmos Ecosystem Campaign on Galxe. The community can suggest other dapps that are live as well as future projects that launch on Evmos. Simple on-chain and off-chain tasks will be leveraged that will allow for high exposure and a low barrier of entry to the Evmos ecosystem. Potential tasks and credentials can include the following:

Following socials (Twitter/Discord)

Retweet/Quote Tweet a specific tweet

Make a swap

Provide liquidity

Buy an NFT and hold for X amount of time

The goal of this initiative is to drive off chain and on chain growth to the Evmos ecosystem

Introduce the Galxe community of 8.2M+ active wallet addresses  to the Evmos ecosystemIntroduce the broader crypto ecosystem to the Evmos ecosystem through Galxe’s tools and co-marketing powerJoint AMA’s

Blog post

Retweets

Quote Tweets

Tweets all throughout the campaign

Discord/Telegram communication

Campaign featured on our main carousel [see: https://galxe.com/campaigns ]

Engage users who aren’t currently in the ecosystem

Educate users on Evmos through learn to earn and participate to earn NFT campaigns

Problems a Galxe campaign addresses

Stagnant growth to the ecosystem

Lack of new users

Absence of engagement

Low exposure

Value that Galxe can add

Drive new, quality users  into the ecosystem from a new web3 audience that Evmos has not had exposure to yet

Increase TVL and transaction volume  on Evmos for long term growth

Discord and Twitter  tools to engage off chain

On chain tools to create on chain loyalty programs

Past experience  with similar campaigns that include Arbitrum, Solana, Optimism, and Moonbeam

Bring users from other EVM and non EVM chains  to the ecosystem

Convert new users into long term, loyal users  of the Evmos ecosystem

Experts  in on chain and off chain growth

Strong marketing power and exposure  from Galxe’s socials and network Twitter : 504K+ (Verified)

Discord : 295K +Co Marketing Galxe can provide:Joint AMA’s

Blog post

Retweet

Quote Tweet

Tweets all throughout the campaign

Discord/Telegram communication

Campaign featured on our main carousel [see: https://galxe.com/campaigns ]

Overall ask and where the funds will go

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

The overall ask is for Evmos to put together an ecosystem campaign on Galxe similar to the likes of the Optimism Quest, Solana’s “2022 is gonna be Sol Cool”, Arbitrum Odyssey, and Moonbeam’s Ultimate Harvest Moon Campaign'' all hosted and coordinated by Galxe. The funds allocated to this campaign will go to the community members who participate in this campaign and not to Galxe.  A scoring system will be put in place for the users who collect all or the majority of badges throughout the campaign. The more NFTs you collect the more you will be rewarded.

https://galxe.com/polygon/campaign/GCNWwUwJBT

Twitter Space Credential Badges claimed after attending a Twitter Space

https://galxe.com/ZetaChain/campaign/GCcGZUtnHZ

Twitter/Discord Credential 169K+ NFTs Minted

https://galxe.com/HopProtocol/campaign/GCmydUtumN

NFT for bridging ETH over to Arbitrum 240K+ NFTs Minted

https://galxe.com/odos/campaign/GChMBUtwGc

NFTs for swapping into specific tokens with a minimum $USD on ODOS DEX 516K+ NFTs Minted

https://docs.galxe.com/case-studies/DEXGrowthWithHashflow

Hashflow DEX Case Study On chain growth from 3,000 - 13,000+ users in 6 weeksTrading volume went from $19.8M - $673M in 6 weeks

https://galxe.com/Optimism/campaign/GC6HiUtSAs

Stargate Bridge Campaign in Optimism Quest 60K+ NFTs Minted

About Galxe

In 2021, Galxe was formed by Bullet Labs  and has seen substantial growth on numerous fronts. Charles Wayn and Harry Zhang co-founded Galxe and previously founded the blockchain streaming service, DLive, where they successfully exited in 2019 after a sale to BitTorrent.

Since inception, Galxe has raised $10M from top VC funds around the globe, had an oversubscribed public sale on CoinList, and launched the $GAL token in May on the majority of tier 1 CEX’s which included Binance and Coinbase  on the first day. Their latest financing round was led by Dragonfly and Multicoin Capital . Most recently, Galxe was awarded the 2022 Binance Launchpool Project of The Year Award.

Galxe has extensive experience in putting together ecosystem campaigns and has delivered superior results  for each ecosystem we’ve partnered with. Running an ecosystem campaign on Galxe comes with incredible co-marketing opportunities that include Retweets, Quote Tweets, Tweets all throughout the campaign, Discord/Telegram communication, Joint AMA’s, Blog post, and Campaigns featured on our main carousel.

Previous Ecosystem Campaigns

Solana’s “2022 is Sol Cool” Campaign

Solana’s ecosystem  added 33,400 new users with each unique user trying an average of 5 protocols on Solana and 4,826 users completing 10 or more tasks from different partners.

Campaign page views for duration of campaign:  1,233,416

Users (unique visitor for duration of campaign):  336,313

NFT Minted:  130,503

**Blog post by Galxe: **https://blog.galxe.com/project-galaxy-presents-2022-is-gonna-be-sol-cool-6445c43a942c

**Case Study: **https://docs.galxe.com/case-studies/EcosystemGrowthWithSolana

Galxe Blog Post for Solana Campaign: https://blog.galxe.com/project-galaxy-presents-2022-is-gonna-be-sol-cool-6445c43a942c

(image)

Arbitrum Odyssey

Campaign page views until 10/13/2022:  2,256,041

Users (unique visitor):  394,992

NFT Minted  420,401 until pause for Nitro (Arbitrum network upgrade) one week in

Blog post by Galxe: https://blog.galxe.com/project-galaxy-teams-up-for-arbitrum-odyssey-104e07edcdc9

Campaign page: https://galxe.com/arbitrum/campaign/GCCNzUtQiW

Optimism Quest

Campaign page views until 11/08/2022:  1,010,701

Users (unique visitor):  64,938

NFT Minted  553,524 to date

Blog post by Galxe: https://blog.galxe.com/galxe-x-optimism-optimism-quests-f060c139d660

Campaign Page: https://galxe.com/Optimism/campaign/GC6xiUtedg

Stargate transactions  after beginning the OP Quest (graphic taken on 9/21)

(image)

(image)

Galxe + OP Twitter Spaces Announcement Tweet

(image)

The Ultimate Harvest Moon Campaign (Moonbeam)

Campaign page views  from 7/28 - 8/11: 214,287

Users (unique visitor):  48,376

NFT Minted:  41,567

Campaign  is paused because of the Nomad hack on Moonbeam

Blog post by Galxe:

https://blog.galxe.com/the-ultimate-harvest-moon-campaign-97d41c5d2f48

Campaign Page: https://galxe.com/Moonbeam/campaign/GCcg1Ut2hD

Galxe Twitter announcement  tweet of Moonbeam campaign

(image)

Funding Request

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

Galxe is requesting a rewards pool of $100K USD in Evmos that will go entirely to community members.  We’re waiving integration fees for this type of campaign but want to make sure the participating community is incentivized and rewarded appropriately. Prior ecosystem campaigns have put forth rewards that have included token airdrop allocation and special governance rights. Solana put forth a rewards pool of $1M USD to participating users and Moonbeam allocated 1.5% of their token supply to this type of campaign.  Funds will be handled and distributed by a multisig wallet controlled by the Evmos community throughout this entire process. The community members who take part in the engagements can expect to receive the funds after the campaign is over. The Evmos Community can decide how reward distribution will be handled. After the integration of Evmos into Galxe, any dApp in the Evmos ecosystem will be able to run growth campaigns on Evmos on Galxe for years to come.

The campaign structure would typically be throughout a number of weeks depending on how many dApps participate. The community can always be extended and more dApps can join in. Users will complete simple on-chain and off-chain tasks on each dapp such as Twitter/Discord actions and swapping, farming, staking, bridging, LP, etc. Evmos can choose to pick the participating dApps itself or can allow the community to vote and choose the participating dApps. The campaign can be structured in the two following ways:

Throughout the duration of the campaign users will have the ability to engage with two dApps per week  and the following week an additional two dApps will become available for users to engage with. Arbitrum is operating their quest like this and we’ve seen success with this structure.

All dApps part of the quest will be available  for users to engage with throughout the duration of the campaign. Optimism is operating their quest like this. This could be useful for DeFi protocols if you want users to stake or provide liquidity for a month or longer

Gaxle has the ability to implement sybil prevention credentials to make sure rewards are not diluted to bots and users with multiple wallets. We currently have the following credentials available

https://galxe.com/credential/207415643290116096 Has at least 30 transactions on Ethereum mainnet after Ethereum Merge

https://galxe.com/credential/187770474584514560 Has at least 10 transaction on Ethereum mainnet

We have the ability to set up credentials that include hold X (.1, .25, .5) amount of ETH on Ethereum

We’re excited to have the opportunity to collaborate with the Evmos community, and leverage our current user base to help with the on-chain growth of the ecosystem. We encourage feedback from the community to ensure we’ve addressed any questions or concerns, so we gain resounding support for this proposal.

Disclaimer: All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.

Optimism is operating their quest like this. This could be useful for DeFi protocols if you want users to stake or provide liquidity for a month or longer\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"Gaxle has the ability to implement sybil prevention credentials to make sure rewards are not diluted to bots and users with multiple wallets. We currently have the following credentials available\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://galxe.com/credential/207415643290116096\"},\"insert\":\"https://galxe.com/credential/207415643290116096\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Has at least 30 transactions on Ethereum mainnet after Ethereum Merge\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"link\":\"https://galxe.com/credential/187770474584514560\"},\"insert\":\"https://galxe.com/credential/187770474584514560\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Has at least 10 transaction on Ethereum mainnet\"},{\"attributes\":{\"indent\":1,\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"We have the ability to set up credentials that include hold X (.1, .25, .5) amount of ETH on Ethereum\"},{\"attributes\":{\"list\":\"bullet\"},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nWe’re excited to have the opportunity to collaborate with the Evmos community, and leverage our current user base to help with the on-chain growth of the ecosystem. We encourage feedback from the community to ensure we’ve addressed any questions or concerns, so we gain resounding support for this proposal.\\n\\nDisclaimer: \"},{\"attributes\":{\"italic\":true},\"insert\":\"All funds will only be distributed to the participating Evmos community.\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Bring Quasar to Evmos: execute Cosmos Transactions & Queries from the EVM, from any smart contract
result.plaintext:
Discussion: [https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/8496-bring-quasar-to-evmos-execute-cosmos-transactions-queries-from-the-evm-from-any-smart-contract](https://commonwealth.im/evmos/discussion/8496-bring-quasar-to-evmos-execute-cosmos-transactions-queries-from-the-evm-from-any-smart-contract)

We made this idea public for Evmos in July 2022, along with a first demo prototype, for the Evmos community.

Now we have a full implementation of the core features.

## Features:

1. Stateful precompiles brought to Ethermint. This includes maintaining a fork of go-ethereum with changes that offer precompiles the same functionality as normal smart contracts. 
2. Both EOA accounts and EVM contracts can execute Cosmos transactions and Cosmos Queries from inside the EVM.
3. Developers have access to a Solidity-compatible library that makes it easy to create Cosmos messages & queries from any smart contract.
4. This tech is unique. No other chain has it other than Mythos, a chain without tradeable currency. Ethereum cannot perform such transactions and Cosmos chains either. This is pure synergy between EVM and Cosmos.

## Usecases

- next-gen decentralized governance: having access to Cosmos gov module data from the EVM, will power real dGov on Evmos, based on actual staking data.
- Evmos-native liquid staking

## Technical Details

- go-ethereum work from https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/26119#issuecomment-1305908559, specifically [these changes](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/compare/master...loredanacirstea:go-ethereum:loredana/extensible-precompiles). This enabled Quasar to be called from smart contracts and not only from EOA accounts.
- I built the Quasar precompile on top of the stateless precompile abstraction stub implemented in Ethermint by Federico Kunze: https://github.com/evmos/ethermint/pull/1272
- I efficiently synchronized Cosmos & EVM execution context frames
- I aligned the Cosmos execution context frame to be reverted or committed to the final state by EVM's StateDB
- the Cosmos execution context frame can account correctly for the state and gas metering of all its children frames.
- like any other contract or precompile, Quasar supports call, delegatecall (behaves like call), and staticcall
- on top of the above, the Solidity-compatible library & ABI encoding/decoding features can be added, so that Cosmos messages & queries can be constructed from a smart contract.

## Demos

Demo video, to understand quasar: https://youtu.be/COu5Olszhtg.

Quasar is available for testing, on [Mythos](https://github.com/cosmos/chain-registry/blob/943428722d7715ecd95cba702bde1be5cc5a06b1/mythos/chain.json). Technical documentation for testing can be found [here](https://github.com/the-laurel/demos/tree/main/docs/precompiles/Quasar).

[Other quasar demo videos.](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL323JufuD9JB1R28TdzCtiiIwTHy9TX5C)

## Timeline

Features 1 & 2 are done. Feature 3 is partially done.
We can deliver a production-ready quasar in 2 weeks and then assist the Evmos Core/Tharsis team to integrate it into their release schedule.


## Author

Loredana Cirstea. Independent core contributor to Evmos and Ethermint. Building for the EVM since 2017. Detailed contributions for my former volunteer efforts [here](https://evolve.provable.dev/). Quasar was ideated and implemented by The Laurel Project team.

result.title: Funding Request - MetaTank
result.plaintext:
Project name: MetaTank

Project type: Gaming

Funding requested: $120k (300,000 Evmos @$0.4).

Milestone 1 - $40k, Milestone 2 - $30k, Milestone 3 - $50k

Contacts

Email: team@metatank.app

Twitter: https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject

Discord: MTNK-Kayz#7680, Deepanshu_xd#7089, kpprabhu#9635

Multisig Members (3 of 4 Multisig):

- InstaFinanzas | Stakin Validator

- Kevin | Oni Validator

- devd331 | Evmos Community Mod

- MTNK-Kayz | MetaTank

Hello all,

We have our materials pinned on our twitter page. Easily readable, with a clear layout (plus videos).

Simple explanation of MetaTank - https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1605612305542045696

If you’d like further details, please check our PDF doc and Gitbook, links here:

PDF - https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FRPwv3yaICEBPbOfyuJMaMjB_LnzYp7n/view?usp=sharing

GITBOOK - https://metatank.gitbook.io/metatank/metatank/introduction

Now, we will present what MetaTank is about, what we aim to do & how we can help grow Evmos (liquidity + users).

IMPORTANT: We are not building on-chain web3 games. There is no Metaverse. We are not including NFTs. No tokens are required to play our games. We are building web2 mobile games (think Subway Surfer for example).

Proof of Capabilities:

Minting - https://twitter.com/KayzMtnk/status/1597694274346573824

In-game wallet - https://twitter.com/KayzMtnk/status/1597697148057157632

Battle System - https://twitter.com/KayzMtnk/status/1597699452562997248

Conversion Platform - https://twitter.com/KayzMtnk/status/1597701006774894594

How Evmos Community Benefits:

Revenues from mobile games injected into Evmos (conversion rewards).

Users must enter Evmos to use Conversion Platform.

Onboarding web2 game developers (with their userbase/IP) via Conversion Platform.

10% of $MTNK supply reserved for Evmos community.

Directing the userbase amassed by MetaTank, promoting Evmos and its ecosystem projects.

Value proposition (lite): https://discord.com/channels/809048090249134080/913597332073898034/1053286938750234704

Brief History

The idea of MetaTank spawned at the height of the GameFi craze in October 2021. We were just a group of blockchain and gaming enthusiasts.

It all turned out to be financial products dressed as gaming products. All dependent on token prices. It became a racket. Weekly launches, games loaded and shilled by presalers ready to dump, it was disheartening.

Web3 games built a large barrier for Web2 gamers to overcome:

- Setup a wallet.

- Signup to an exchange.

- Purchase Tokens/NFTs.

Multiple actions required before users can even begin to play.

This was not gaming. This was not MetaTank. We sought something different.

Our first Entry – Theatre of War.

This is just a showcase of our capabilities. Not what we will be building.

Self-funded, we raised around $70k and built our first game.

Trailer - https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600981858661326848

Impressive for the amount of resources we had. Loaded with several features. Fairly challenging gameplay mechanics that require strategy. A lot more complex than simply using RNG.

You can see here – https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600981867485806593

However, Theatre of War still based on old Web3 principals.

With our capabilities, we want to bring a fresh new look at gaming to Evmos.

Project MetaTank

MetaTank a series of games based around a gameverse (think Marvel Universe but for games).

Gritty, dystopian. Technologically advanced societies, resource-scarcity and overt/covert power-struggles.

 Our Plan (Utilizing our Conversion Platform):

To create a portfolio of mobile games and generate revenues (Ads/IAPs)

Pour revenues into Evmos (rewards) and further game development.

Onboard Web2 game developers onto Evmos, via our Conversion Platform.

Build a franchise and strong IP.

A key driver behind our approach is our Conversion Platform – https://twitter.com/KayzMtnk/status/1597701006774894594

Conversion Platform - Allows users to convert in-game rewards into on-chain tokens. To do so, they must enter Evmos.

How the process works - For Users

1 - Download a MetaTank mobile game on any appstore. Play like any normal game (think Flappy Bird) and win in-game points.

2 - Leave it at that or convert in-game points into Conversion Currency.

3 - Go on to the Conversion Platform, link their Metamask account + Game account and swap the Conversion Currency for $MTNK.

4 - With on-chain (Evmos) $MTNK tokens, user can sell or interact with the Evmos ecosystem (provide liquidity, build a portfolio).

Mobile gaming

Just a quick primer, no stats overload. Mobile Gaming is a behemoth, it continues to grow.

Everyone spends hours on their phones. All genders and ages now game on their mobiles.

Mobile gaming landscape - https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600983442648272898

Two types of mobile games are dominating, in terms of downloads and revenue.

Hypercasual/casual games – Downloads

Strategy/RPG games – Revenue

Each with their own benefits (Key Comparisons Table) – https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600984818179018752

Strategy

We aim to build a portfolio of Hypercasual games.

Each game will be: stream friendly, lore-based and fun.

Built with a 3-currency system (creating incentives) - https://metatank.gitbook.io/metatank/games/mobile-gaming/hypercasual-games

Over time, we will proceed to work on more complex Strategy/RPG games, to strengthen our IP.

On strategy – https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600984809807171584

Gaming concepts – https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600986152508436480

Of the revenues we generate, they will be distributed between:

Rewards Liquidity Pool - Buying MTNK tokens to keep the pool balanced.

Game development - Reinvesting into building and marketing more games.

Expected revenues

Expected earnings are always fluctuating and vary depending on many factors such as geography.

Brief explanation of revenues – https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600987744179666945

Our games will be optimized to blend rewarded ads into gameplay. Some will offer surveys (great additional revenue).

Using a low figure ARPDAU of $0.03, for our Hypercasual games. 1k users (a very small number for a hypercasual) can bring in $900 in revenue, monthly.

By further optimizing for our rewarded ads and including IAPs. Revenues could be further increased.

Revenue = In-app Advertisements + In-app Purchases.

Data:

Https://appodeal.com/blog/mobile-ecpm-report-app-ad-monetization-worldwide-performance/

The metrics behind Hyper-Casual Games, GameAnalytics 2020 - Report

Hypercasual dev costs- from $3k to $100k.

Dev time - weeks to months.

Popular game mechanics can be re-adjusted and used again.

Incremental costs decrease with more games built.

MTNK Token

Our token will not be used to play our Hypercasual games.

Games are independent of token price.

Initially, it is a reward token.

In the future, stake $MTNK to receive stablecoins.

We’ll have a staking capacity of 15%-30% of supply.

The system is simple and explained here – https://twitter.com/MetaTankProject/status/1600988337921486851

Our tokenomics - https://metatank.gitbook.io/metatank/usdmtnk/tokenomics

Our Proposal

We are requesting $120k. Happy to have multiple trusted signatories to keep funds safe.

$55k - Game development (game design, lore, artworks, licensing, localization etc)

$35k - Conversion Platform (database, cooldowns adjustable rates, min/max etc)

$20k - Marketing Campaigns (paid game Ads, press release, trailers, social media, streamers etc) app review.

$10k - Initial liquidity for game rewards.

Milestone 1 - $40k or 100,000 Evmos (Conversion Platform, Game Development Pt1).

Amount Released: 33% 			Expected duration: 2 months

Milestone 2 - $30k or 75,000 Evmos (Platform Audit, Game Development Pt2).

Amount Released: 25% 				Expected duration: 1.5 months

Milestone 3 - $50k or 125,000 Evmos (Game Development Pt3, Marketing, Rewards liquidity pool).

Amount Released: 42% 			Expected duration: Ongoing

In return, we’d airdrop 5% of our $MTNK tokens in the future (after a few game launches).

Another 5% is reserved for future arrangements.

Also, as MetaTank is growing its IP. We’d like to create make a pact with Evmos to share a % of revenues earned from our IP.

Growing with Evmos

As we have shown, we will be bringing liquidity and users.

Should any mobile game go viral, Evmos directly benefits.

Our mobile games can serve as a medium to educate users on Evmos (can be gamified and integrated into the game).

Many are limited in their thinking, Web3 gaming is more than NFTs and Metaverses.

Onboard Web2 developers through our Conversion Platform. Organizations with fanbases and established IPs, looking for an entry and method of monetization in Crypto.

Let’s build a new gaming culture. Have Evmos pave the way for what blockchain gaming could be.

Thank you for your time. Please share the message and your thoughts.

We are open to advice and willing to see how we can make it work together and grow Evmos.

Happy to have multiple trusted signatories to keep funds safe.\\n$55k - Game development (game design, lore, artworks, licensing, localization etc)  \\n$35k - Conversion Platform (database, cooldowns adjustable rates, min/max etc)\\n$20k - Marketing Campaigns (paid game Ads, press release, trailers, social media, streamers etc) app review.\\n$10k - Initial liquidity for game rewards.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Milestone 1\"},{\"insert\":\" - $50k (Game development PT1 & Conversion Platform) \\nExp: 3 Months\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Milestone 2 \"},{\"insert\":\"- $70k (Game development PT2, Marketing & Game Rewards).\\nIn return, we’d airdrop 5% of our $MTNK tokens in the future (after a few game launches).\\n\\nAnother 5% is reserved for future arrangements.\\nAlso, as MetaTank is growing its IP. We’d like to create make a pact with Evmos to share a % of revenues earned from our IP.\\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":1},\"insert\":\"\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Growing with Evmos\"},{\"attributes\":{\"header\":1},\"insert\":\"\\n\\n\"},{\"insert\":\"As we have shown, we will be \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"bringing liquidity and users.\"},{\"insert\":\"\\nShould any mobile game go viral, \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Evmos directly benefits. \"},{\"insert\":\"\\nOur mobile games can serve as a \"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"medium to educate users on Evmos \"},{\"insert\":\"(can be gamified and integrated into the game). \\n\\nMany are limited in their thinking, Web3 gaming is more than NFTs and Metaverses.  \\nOnboard Web2 developers through our Conversion Platform. Organizations with fanbases and established IPs, looking for an entry and method of monetization in Crypto. \\n\\n\"},{\"attributes\":{\"bold\":true},\"insert\":\"Let’s build a new gaming culture. Have Evmos pave the way for what blockchain gaming could be.\"},{\"insert\":\"\\n\\nThank you for your time. Please share the message and your thoughts.\\n\\nWe are open to advice and willing to see how we can make it work together and grow Evmos.  \\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\\n\"}]}"}

result.title: Hadron - Bringing Lending Markets to Evmos
result.plaintext:
(image) Overview:

In line with previous proposal to kickstart DeFi on Evmos , we’re proposing that Evmos governance helps provide 250k Evmos in liquidity mining incentives and a 100k deposit of wEVMOS into Hadron, a lending protocol on Evmos.

Plan of Action:

Evmos has recognized the need to increase the DeFi activity on Evmos in anticipation for the decrease of staking rewards.

We think that there’s an interesting opportunity at the intersection of the EVM and Cosmos, tapping both the battle proven models of DeFi, with the hundreds of millions in Cosmos DeFi assets.

With Diffusion kicking off the influx of TVL and DeFi activity on Evmos, the next logical step is to boost a lending protocol built on top of Evmos to continue the flywheel effects.

A lending protocol is key as it’s heavily synergistic with other protocols on Evmos:

Depositing stables and borrowing Evmos allows for delta neutral farming on Diffusion

A stable pool with cTokens allows for LPs to collect lending yield in addition to swap fees on Kinesis

The listing of various assets (including Juno, Atom, and Osmosis) encourages the bridging of these assets

To this end, we’re in discussion with potential partners, and have already announced a partnership with Kinesis , the leading stableswap on Evmos.

Kinesis will provide rewards to cToken pairs, enabling the 2nd use case described.

For more typical users, we can expect that the following use cases:

the ability to earn lending yield on their Evmos (and stEvmos)

liquidity for holders of WEVMOS (and eventually stEVMOS) without selling

the ability to short tokens (especially for Cosmos tokens)

We believe that the primary use case will be a strong driver of supply/TVL as a way for users to earn strong yields from both staking and lending.

For our testnet alone, hundreds of users have used our protocol for deposits and borrows of various assets.

Evmos DAO deposit

We’re also seeking an additional deposit of 100k EVMOS to deposit into the protocol. This will allow Evmos DAO to accrue both interest fees, Hadron tokens, and further bootstrap the protocol.

This is an initial small allocation to get the Evmos DAO comfortable with Hadron’s safety along with PoL, especially as we plan on scaling up our ask in a succeeding governance proposal.

This will be managed by the current multisig controlling Hadron as the safety of Hadron is proven in the market, and is significantly more cost effective in driving liquidity than just liquidity mining.

Since this is a deposit, Evmos DAO controls can choose to withdraw, and opens up possibilities for borrowing other assets for either funding DAO activities or providing liquidity to other protocols in the ecosystem – of which we have several ideas for.

Liquidity Mining

250k EVMOS tokens designated for Hadron to incentivize both borrowing and lending over one month, managed by a multisig consisting of the Hadron team, Orbital Apes, and other members from the Evmos Community.

We will be using the rewards distributor baked into Compound to increase rewards for each pair as they increase or decrease in TVL, with the focus being on rewards for borrowing and lending of WEVMOS.

The makeup will be as follows:

40% WEVMOS lending and borrowing

30% Bridged stablecoins

20% Cosmos Assets

10% Bridged Majors (WETH, WBTC)

We plan on scaling up the ask for the liquidity mining program 2 months into the program, with a goal of building up trust for the Evmos DAO, along with providing an opportunity to evaluate the effectiveness of the liquidity mining program.

The below spreadsheet contains details for how we would expect the initial grant + scaled up distribution to be deployed as.

Distribution will be front loaded, in order to bootstrap the protocol, although we predict that native protocol revenue will sustain the TVL as time continues.

See below sheet for distribution details along with expected milestones.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NfQ9On7KG1ageXhfRYhE-krErKu1JFpfjGZkPgr3a28/edit#gid=0

Safety:

We’re conscious of safety and will have WEVMOS, JUNO, OSMO, ATOM, Axelar, Celer, and Gravity bridged assets with conservative LTVs as borrowable assets.

If we feel a bridge is unsafe, we will work towards either reducing LTVs, or removing protocol assets all together.

We've also secured an audit , and will have a bug bounty program in the coming weeks.

About Hadron Finance:

Hadron based on the Cream Finance protocol, which itself is based on the Compound V2 codebase. We’re currently deployed to Evmos Testnet, and are planning on launching to Evmos Mainnet in the coming weeks.

We’ve integrated the Adrastia oracle for price feeds, which queries prices and checks on chain liquidity for the most optimal pricing.

The Hadron team is composed of experienced DeFi users who have both run multi million dollar protocols on other chains and have extensively used DeFi.

Dr.Kinesis, the founder of Kinesis Labs, is involved as an advisor for strategy and protocol development.

Roadmap:

For our roadmap, outside of the launch in the coming weeks, we plan on adding more assets (including Cosmos assets), and partnering with other protocols on Evmos to increase the synergies between Hadron and the rest of the burgeoning DeFi ecosystem.

To this end, we've already partnered with Kinesis, Celer, Axelar, Gravity, and have several others on the way.

We plan on having a token to allow for maximal decentralization and allow for full community control of the protocol and parameters, but these details will be solidified at a later date.

The current plan is to airdrop a nontransferrable token in order to bootstrap a governance set, and emit these tokens as part of liquidity mining, with a goal of fairly distributing governance to the community and the elected stewards.
